comments.body: We will have to add a new one of these functions for every SIG, any reason why we don't do a generic one which can take an argument and output `[sig-{arg}]`?

`I would say that the cost of adding 3 boiler-plate lines isn't a big cost.
OTOH - that gives compile time guarantees that if we implement that function correctly, the other also will have correct tags.

[I don't feel very strongly about this though...]
Would it make sense to add a check here that `text` do not have `[sig-` substring? Also same check maybe useful for `ginkgo.By` wrapper
